articles.author: Thomas Escritt, Sabine Siebold
articles.description: Western powers and countries from the rest of the world will use the second day of a major summit in Switzerland on Sunday to pursue a consensus on condemning Russia's invasion of Ukraine and underscoring concerns about the war's human cost.
articles.title: Ukraine summit strives for broad consensus to lean on Russia to end war

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Six detainees, some with links to Islamic State, took guards hostage at a pre-trial detention centre in Russia's southern region of Rostov and demanded free passage in negotiations with the authorities, Russian media reported on Sunday.
articles.title: Prisoners with ISIS links take guards hostage in Russian detention centre, media report

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: German police fired shots at a person who threatened officers with a pickaxe and an incendiary device on the sidelines of a soccer fan parade in the St Pauli district of central Hamburg on Sunday, according to a police post on social media platform X.
articles.title: German police fire shots at axe-wielding person at Hamburg soccer fan parade

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Former French President Nicolas Sarkozy warned on Sunday that President Emmanuel Macron's unexpected decision to dissolve the National Assembly and call for snap legislative elections could backfire and plunge the country into chaos.
articles.title: Former French President Sarkozy flags chaos risk as election looms

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hamas Qatar-based leader Ismail Haniyeh said the group's response to the latest Gaza ceasefire proposal is consistent with the principles put forward by U.S. President Joe Biden's plan, in a televised speech on the occasion of the Islamic Eid al-Adha on Sunday.
articles.title: Hamas leader says group's response to latest Gaza ceasefire proposal 'consistent' with principles of Biden's plan

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Kyiv's positions have been taken into consideration in the final communique for a summit of world leaders convened to pursue peace in Ukraine's war with Russia, Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba said on Sunday.
articles.title: Ukraine says peace summit communique takes Kyiv's positions into consideration

articles.author: Ben Blanchard, Ann Wang
articles.description: China views the annexation and "elimination" of Taiwan as its great national cause, Taiwan President Lai Ching-te said on Sunday, telling cadets at the military's premier academy they must know their enemy and not give in to defeatism.
articles.title: China views Taiwan's 'elimination' as national cause, Taiwan president says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's Wuhan Tianyu Information Industry said on Sunday the U.S. including it on a sanctions list was a "unilateral" act that could affect the data security company's foreign exchange settlements.
articles.title: China's Wuhan Tianyu says inclusion on US sanctions list may impact forex transactions

articles.author: Crispian Balmer
articles.description: Since taking office in 2022, Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni has proved a pragmatic partner on major international issues, assuaging fears she would be a dogmatic conservative unwilling to compromise.
articles.title: Italy's Meloni shows her arch-conservative credentials at G7 summit

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's National Meteorological Centre on Sunday issued an alert for high temperatures as multiple regions across the country experience sweltering heat, while many southern provinces issued severe flood warnings due to heavy rains.
articles.title: Flooding hits China's south, temperatures sizzle elsewhere
